feed.subtitle: A personal page with the blog and CV.

entry.title: PGDay Belgium 2023 reflections
entry.summary: As a senior database consultant and developer at CYBERTEC PostgreSQL International, I recently enjoyed presenting at PGDay Belgium 2023 at the UCLL campus Proximus in Haasrode.

entry.title: LZ4 and ZSTD pg_dump compression in PostgreSQL 16

link.title: LZ4 and ZSTD pg_dump compression in PostgreSQL 16

entry.summary: LZ4 and ZSTD are additional pg_dump compression methods added in PostgreSQL 16. Find out how to use them, & how they compare to GZIP.

entry.title: Underscores in numeric constants in PostgreSQL 16

link.title: Underscores in numeric constants in PostgreSQL 16

entry.summary: PostgreSQL 16 includes support for underscores in integer and numeric constants. Learn how to use them in large numbers without errors.

entry.title: Parallel aggregate in PostgreSQL 16 for better performance

link.title: Parallel aggregate in PostgreSQL 16 for better performance

entry.summary: A new functionality for parallel aggregates on string_agg() and array_agg() functions is coming in PostgreSQL 16 with improved performance.

entry.title: New old “debug_parallel_query” setting in PostgreSQL 16
entry.summary: force_parallel_mode - the runtime option will have a new name in PostgreSQL 16: debug_parallel_query. Find out why.

entry.title: pg_timetable v5.3 is out!
entry.summary: pg_timetable v5.3 release is here - new logging features include: disable database logging, plus 4 new ways to control file logging.

entry.title: ER diagrams with SQL and Mermaid

link.title: ER diagrams with SQL and Mermaid

entry.summary: Generate an ER diagram for a PostgreSQL database using plain SQL and Mermaid. Explore entity relationship diagrams for architecture/dev

entry.title: Go & PostgreSQL: FOSDEM 2023 talk
entry.content: On the 5th of February 2023, I had the privilege of giving a talk at the PostgreSQL devroom during FOSDEM 2023 titled “When it all GOes right.” My talk focused on the process of creating programs in the Go language using a PostgreSQL database. It was an incredible opportunity to share my insights and experiences with fellow open-source enthusiasts from around the world, and to discuss the latest trends and developments in this rapidly evolving field. In this blog post, I’ll provide the key takeaways and links to the sources to explore some of the most exciting innovations in Go and PostgreSQL programming. Slides in PDF format are available on the FOSDEM PgDay 2023 event page.

entry.title: Reserve connections for the pg_use_reserved_connections group in PostgreSQL 16

link.title: Reserve connections for the pg_use_reserved_connections group in PostgreSQL 16

entry.summary: A brand-new patch in PostgreSQL 16 provides a way to reserve connection slots for non-superusers. Find out the news here!
